attributes.additional_details: The governing party is widely seen to have misled voters and abandoned key manifesto commitments. Had its true intentions been made clear during the campaign, the election result may have been markedly different. Democratic accountability now demands that the electorate be given the opportunity to respond to this breach of trust.
attributes.background: A general election should be called so that the British public can vote on the government’s actual policy proposals, rather than on commitments that were not delivered. This would ensure that voters have a fair and accurate basis on which to make their democratic choice

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action:

Dissolve Parliament and call a General Election now!
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/750050
